headline: Chef John's Pumpkin Spice Snickerdoodles
description: The flavors of pumpkin spice work beautifully in these classic buttery, cinnamon sugar cookies.

video.description: The quintessential snickerdoodle all spiced up!
video.name: Chef John's Pumpkin Spice Snickerdoodles

name: Chef John's Pumpkin Spice Snickerdoodles

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper.
Place flour, salt, baking soda, and cream of tartar in a mixing bowl. Add cinnamon, ginger, allspice, clove, and nutmeg. Whisk until thoroughly mixed, 1 or 2 minutes.

Place butter, sugar, and brown sugar in a separate mixing bowl. Cream together with a spatula or wooden spoon until mixture is smooth, 2 or 3 minutes. Add vanilla and egg. Stir until thoroughly combined.
Pour flour mixture into butter mixture. Stir until just combined or until the flour disappears.
Wrap bowl in plastic wrap. Chill dough in refrigerator for about 1 hour.
Stir cinnamon and sugar together in a shallow bowl or plate.
Scoop dough into 2 tablespoon balls. Roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat all sides. Roll into smooth ball and place on prepared baking sheet, 3 to 4 inches apart. Flatten slightly.
Bake in preheated oven until browned, 10 to 12 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet 5 minutes; sprinkle with additional cinnamon-sugar mixture, if desired. Transfer cookies to cooling rack to cool completely.

If you'd like to add a bit of a shine to your cookies, you can brush them with a simple glaze. Mix confectioners' sugar with milk or lemon juice to achieve brushing consistency. Brush onto cookies. Sprinkle with more cinnamon sugar or pumpkin pie spice, if desired.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! It made 20 cookies so not a lot but well worth it . I'll double the recipe next time. The spice blend is perfect! It took 14 minutes instead of the 10-12 minutes.
These cookies are OK, but there's no pumpkin in the recipe which is what I wanted.

These cookies are my new favorite. I made these as a surprise for my mom so she could eat cookies after work, and these are definitely going to be made many more times. I accidentally doubled the amount of nutmeg, but it still tastes really good that way! I'm making these for my family when Thanksgiving rolls around!
Mine didn't flatten but the flavor was very good. I used the meatball scoop to make them and got 24. Baked them 13 minutes.
Delicious!!!
They were just okay, not worth all that hand mixing. I will stick to regular Snickerdoodles.
ok but not great. I had to add extra liquid and they spread out to much.
Love Love Love these!! Anytime I see anything "Chef John" It is always a hit!!
Fabulous cookies! You might want to double the recipe because these will disappear quickly.

These are the best cookies ever! So soft and delicious with a lot of flavor, also really easy to make. I made them exactly like the recipe said and they are perfect. :) The only thing is that I used 2 & a half tsp of premade pumpkin spice instead of using all the individual spices (I don't have them), but I don't think it made much of a difference. I recommend this recipe!!! Will be making many more times in the future
These are delicious! Perfectly chewy inside while crispy on the edges. Spice is perfect!
The only bad thing I can say about this recipe is that you need to double immediately! They are gone in a flash otherwise. These might even be better than regular snickerdoodles.
Delicious! one batch made 16 cookies, now I have to make more because everyone wants some!!!

These are my favourite snickerdoodles. They are soft and chewy. They do not take very long to make and are always a hit in the fall. 

Note: I would recommend using fine salt instead of kosher salt. I have made these several times with kosher salt and it causes salt to be the first thing you taste in the cookies.
This is an amazing recipe, my whole family enjoyed it and now I have made 2 batches! One for our family, and I even made a second batch for another family!

These are amazing! My granddaughter and I made these as an end of year gift for her teachers. We doubled the recipe. I subbed 1 1/2 teas pumpkin pie spice for the allspice, cloves and nutmeg. (I was out of allspice) For a single recipe that would be about 3/4 teas. We didn't make the glaze, ran out of time but they didn't seem to need it anyway. Thank You for a great recipe!
These are delish!!
Made these and liked them better than the typical Snickerdoodle. Only change I made was to bake the at 400 instead of 350 and adjusted the time down a minute due to the nature of my oven.
Absolutely fabulous! Making them a second time only days later because we just can’t get enough!!
Followed recipe exactly. The best snickerdoodle recipe hands down.
I love them! This my new favorite cookie! Than you for the recipe.
these are the bomb. thanks Chef John. my Christmas cookie list now includes these delectables.
Tastes great! We cookie cutter'd them and frosted

I’ve made this a few times and it NEVER disappoints. I mixed it by hand, just as John suggests, and it turned out perfect every time. The first few times I substituted an equal amount of “pumpkin pie spice” for all the spices listed and it tasted about the same as following the recipe using the spices listed. Also, I chilled the dough for 45 mins to anhiur
Very simple to make but the dough seemed very dry. Flavor was very good.

Fantastic! Made them exactly according to the recipe. These are by far the best snickerdoodles I've ever tasted. As others have noted, they do spread out to be rather large. I only got 16 cookies. Will need to make a lot more!

Didn't bother with the glaze - they don't need it

I made these for the kids for Thanksgiving and they were a hit. Nice and chewy with great pumpkin pie spice flavor. The only thing I did different was add a pinch of the spice to the rolling sugar for extra flavor. Will definitely make again; maybe even as a Christmas cookie instead of plain snickerdoodles.

Not as crispy as snickerdoodles. Was that because of using butter instead if shortening? The pumpkin pie seasoning made them great! My only regret is that since this is such a small batch, I will never find out if they are crispier after a day!
i loved the pumpkin spice that was added
These are just perfect.
Everyone at work absolutely loved this cookie. I had to make copies of the recipe and hand it out.

Made these to bring into the office, my head manager, who is an executive, told me that these were some of the best cookies he’s ever had. That’s some serious praise and definitely earned me some brownie points. Really though, followed this recipe to a tee and they were delicious. Will be adding to my recipe box!

We loved these cookies! I didn't put the extra sugar on the outside but the cookies were still very flavorful. They stayed soft for several days. I will definitely be making these again. Chef John had me at pumpkin!
Every time I make these, they're gone before you know it. I skip the cloves since I hate the taste and add a little extra of the other spices to give a stronger flavour.
I made these for a fall party back in September, and they were one of the most beautiful things I've ever eaten! Seriously wonderful, and I barely had any left after the party.
Followed recipe exactly, just the right amount of spices for ice cream sandwiches using vanilla ice cream. Will make cookies a little smaller as even adults felt like one sandwich was a lot to eat!
Wonderful and easy! We added a little more pumpkin spice.. Also, we didn't have anything but salted butter but they turned out just fine! lol Will try with unsalted next time!
Absolutely delicious. Just the right crunch and nice and soft in the middle
I doubled the cinnamon and ginger, and these turned out great! Next time I might increase the amount of nutmeg as well. Brought them to a potluck, and they disappeared quickly.
I added the glaze and the sugar on top! Husband's job is requesting more!

These cookies are wonderful. I made a batch of them and brought them to my daughter's job while they were still warm. She and her co-workers devoured them within 15 minutes. Thank you so much for this wonderful recipe Chef John.
Yummy and easy to make. Followed recipe and will make again.

These are SO good and 10x better than a normal snickerdoodle. I wouldn't say pumpkin flavor specifically, more like a general spice but to be honest I think I prefer that because I then I can make them year round. I followed the recipe exactly, but ran out of time and wasn't able to put my second batch in the refrigerator. They still tasted great, they just came out a different shape (more flat) than the batch I did refrigerate.
I will make it again!

I made this recipes as is except substituted aquafaba for the egg due to my daughters egg allergy. These were amazing!!! Definitely a new staple cookie in our home. Every loved them. So soft and the spices are perfect.

They did not spread like photo and I'm unsure about the kosher salt, depends on what your taste buds want. They are good; I dipped the mounds in butter icing and everyone said they were awesome! Thanks for the recipe! Will be making them again.

Yummy. None were left after Thanksgiving dinner. I did make one small change and made the cookies smaller since our family has a number of children and they like small cookies. I used about 1 tablespoon of batter for each cookie.
Very disappointing. Followed recipe to the letter but they did not come out like the snickerdoodles I have had before. They were cake-y and did not have much flavor.

I'm not a baker by any stretch, but after watching the video recipe I became obsessed with making these. Oh. My. Goodness! One of the best cookies I've ever tasted, let alone made! Don't be worried if they seem a little soft if you take them out after 11 minutes- they'll firm right up but stay wonderfully soft in the middle. Don't need another cookie recipe!

Snickerdoodles aren't something I make a lot, but Chef John's version with extra fall spices are yummy! Followed the recipe exactly, including refrigerating an hour before baking. Baked the first two batches 11 minutes, and the last batch (just 3) for 9 minutes, just to see the difference. Think 11 was a little long - would stick with 9 next time for a little softer cookie. Only complaint is that this only yielded 2 dozen cookies (27, to be exact) ... need to double the recipe and freeze some!
Fantastic cookies!
I thought these would have pumpkin puree in them and was surprised they didn't. But they are wonderfully delicious without it. Chef John always comes through.
Easy and amazing!

Delicious!!! I was not expecting them to be this good. I made them with King arthurs gluten free flour, earths balance margarine and organic sugar. My gluten loving husband said they were the best snickerdoodles he ever had - which is saying a lot since his mother bakes all the time. I haven't baked in ages so it was a nice surprise. Kids had fun baking too.
I made these exactly as the recipe ordered. I live at a higher altitude, so I had to bake them for about 14 minutes and they came out more fluffy and cakey. Overall a wonderful cookie!
I am not a huge snickerdoodle fan but I really enjoyed these cookies!!

In all my years of baking, I have never made snickerdoodles but when I saw this recipe, I decided to try it. I followed the recipe exactly (who can argue with Chef John's recipes) and they turned out just about the best sugar-type cookies I have ever made. My husband is very fond of spicy desserts and this really made his day. They were soft the day they were made and a little crunchy the following days. No matter what, they were very good and I am sure to make them again. Very easy to make.
These were so good! I loved the mix of spices & that they're made with all butter, not shortening. My family loved them. The cookies spread more than I was expecting, so just be aware of that.
These cookies are really good! I omitted the allspice because I didn't have any but other than that I followed the recipe exactly.

I love snickerdoodles and have been making them for over 40 years. I read the recipe and immediately whipped up a batch.
They were delicious! My husband, who does not normally eat snickerdoodles, was drawn in by the smells filling my kitchen.
Unfortunately, it looks like I will have to share my snickerdoodles. LOL

I had a hard time deciding whether to give this 4 or 5 stars...and finally went with 4. To be honest, I felt the recipe title was misleading. I was expecting the recipe to have some pumpkin puree in it. It is instead just your average snickerdoodle cookie, with some extra spices thrown in. Don't get me wrong, it tastes great, as nearly everything from Chef John does!
